alert.note: Alert for Jay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 11:06AM EST until March 05 at 11:07PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting White, Pulaski and Carroll Counties. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Fulton IN, Starke, Marshall, Kosciusko and Pulaski Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... Eel River at North Manchester affecting Cass IN, Whitley, Miami, Wabash and Kosciusko Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salamonie River at Portland. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Low spots along the walking trails, including the picnic pavilion, at the Hudson Family Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Saturday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 2.9 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
